translation: The contact of the senses with the objects, O son of Kunti, which causes heat and cold, pleasure and pain, has a beginning and an end; they are impermanent; endure them bravely, O Arjuna.
commentary: 2.14 Quantity touches contacts of senses with objects? You indeed? Kaunteya O Kaunteya (son of Kunti)? producers of cold and heat, pleasure and pain? pleasure and pain? Agamapayinah with beginning and end? impermanent impermanent? Tan them? Titikshasva bear (thou)? Bharata O Bharata.Commentary -- Cold is pleasant at one time and painful at another. Heat is pleasant in winter but painful in summer. The same object
